content.title: Balloon-Expandable Stents
content.description: Vascular stents mounted on balloon catheters that expand when balloon is inflated, typically made from stainless steel or cobalt-chromium alloy.
content.mechanism: Stent plastically deforms when balloon inflated, maintaining expanded diameter after balloon deflation.

characteristics.radial_force: High initial radial force, excellent for calcified lesions

content.deployment_technique: Position at target, inflate balloon to nominal/rated pressure, deflate and remove
advantages: Can be further expanded with larger balloon
limitations: Not suitable for vessels with external compression
